description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger, from title of main text. Physical description: The main text (fol. 21a-102a) is written in a neat medium small naskh in black ink with use of red, with 19 lines per page (written surface: 125 x 65 mm.). European paper with watermark. Marginal annotations. Fol. 1 and 113 are later added fly-leaves. On fol. 2b-3a is a table of contents for the main text. Foliation in red pencil using Arabic numerals on fol. 21a-102a (main text). This foliation is used in the table of contents fol. 2b-3a. Inscription "584" in Arabic numerals on the upper cover and on fol. 1a. Origin: According to a note on the margin of the end of the main text, this was copied by Muṣṭafá ibn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Ḥusaynī al-shahīr bi-ZīrakʹZādah (fol. 102a).
author: Ḥalabī, Ṣāliḥ Naṣr Allāh ibn Sallūm.
abstract: A treatise on Paracelsian medicine, preceded and followed by several folios with notes and excerpts on medicine and alchemy. The copy also contains two sheets of paper with notes.
contents: 11. fol. 102b-112b: [Short excerpts and notes in Ottoman Turkish and Arabic on plants and questions pertaining to medicine and alchemy, some attributed to Jābir in his Kitāb al-Sabʻīn (fol. 106a) and to Ṣadr al-Dīn al-Qunawī (fol. 110b)].
title: al-Ṭibb al-jadīd al-kimiyāʼī ... [etc.].
provenance: Several ownership statements, some with seal, on fol. 2a, one dated 1107 H. [1695 or 6]. Two ownership statements in the name of Muḥammad Saʻīd and of ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq, and one seal reading "Muḥammad" on fol. 20a.
creator: حلبي، صالح نصر الله بن سلوم
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding note: Quarter bound in brown leather and marbled paper. Yellow paper pastedowns. Wear.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
